page.title: 03Cultivated Land
page.content: The area is a traditional farming community and much of the land is devoted to cultivating crops. The flat and slightly undulating land together with rich soils provide a good base for profitable farming. The areas where crops are grown are mainly flat valley floors, although crops can be found on the hilly ground nearby. The farmland is mainly cultivated with barley, corn, hay and other cereal crops. Root vegetables such as turnips and potatoes are also grown as well other vegetables such as peas. The original field dimensions have largely been retained with hawthorn and holly hedges enclosing the fields. Recently the main farmers had the opportunity to enlarge their acreage when the firm, McLaren, who were the main landowners, sold all their land.
